Solution.

  1. The poles of fff are precisely the poles of zsin⁡πz\frac{z}{\sin{\pi z}}sinπzz​ since cos⁡πz\cos{\pi z}cosπz is entire. Since sin⁡πz\sin{\pi z}sinπz has a simple pole at 000, it follows that zsin⁡πz\frac{z}{\sin{\pi z}}sinπzz​ is analytic near the origin, so the poles of fff are at Z∖{0}\Z \setminus \set{0}Z∖{0}. Given k∈Z∖{0}k \in \Z \setminus \set{0}k∈Z∖{0}, sin⁡πz\sin{\pi z}sinπz has a simple zero at kkk, so we may take the following limit from the real direction and apply L'Hôpital's:

    Res⁡(f;k)=lim⁡z→k(z−k)f(z)=−πlim⁡x→kx(x−k)sin⁡πx=−πlim⁡x→kx+x−kπcos⁡πx=−kcos⁡πk=(−1)k+1k.\begin{aligned} \Res{f}{k} &= \lim_{z \to k} \p{z - k}f\p{z} \\ &= -\pi \lim_{x \to k} \frac{x\p{x - k}}{\sin{\pi x}} \\ &= -\pi \lim_{x \to k} \frac{x + x - k}{\pi\cos{\pi x}} \\ &= -\frac{k}{\cos{\pi k}} \\ &= \p{-1}^{k+1} k. \end{aligned}Res(f;k)​=z→klim​(z−k)f(z)=−πx→klim​sinπxx(x−k)​=−πx→klim​πcosπxx+x−k​=−cosπkk​=(−1)k+1k.​

    2z2z2−k2=2+2k2z2−k2=2+k(1z−k−1z+k)\frac{2z^2}{z^2 - k^2} = 2 + \frac{2k^2}{z^2 - k^2} = 2 + k\p{\frac{1}{z - k} - \frac{1}{z + k}}z2−k22z2​=2+z2−k22k2​=2+k(z−k1​−z+k1​)

    g(2n−2)(z)=∑k=1∞k((−1)2n−2(2n−2)!(z−k)2n−1−(−1)2n−2(2n−2)!(z+k)2n−1)=∑k=1∞k((2n−2)!(z−k)2n−1−(2n−2)!(z+k)2n−1)g(2n−2)(0)=∑k=1∞k((2n−2)!(−k)2n−1−(2n−2)!k2n−1)=−2∑k=1∞(2n−2)!k2n.\begin{aligned} g^{\p{2n-2}}\p{z} &= \sum_{k=1}^\infty k\p{\p{-1}^{2n-2}\frac{\p{2n - 2}!}{\p{z - k}^{2n-1}} - \p{-1}^{2n-2}\frac{\p{2n - 2}!}{\p{z + k}^{2n-1}}} \\ &= \sum_{k=1}^\infty k\p{\frac{\p{2n - 2}!}{\p{z - k}^{2n-1}} - \frac{\p{2n - 2}!}{\p{z + k}^{2n-1}}} \\ g^{\p{2n-2}}\p{0} &= \sum_{k=1}^\infty k\p{\frac{\p{2n - 2}!}{\p{-k}^{2n-1}} - \frac{\p{2n - 2}!}{k^{2n-1}}} \\ &= -2 \sum_{k=1}^\infty \frac{\p{2n - 2}!}{k^{2n}}. \end{aligned}g(2n−2)(z)g(2n−2)(0)​=k=1∑∞​k((−1)2n−2(z−k)2n−1(2n−2)!​−(−1)2n−2(z+k)2n−1(2n−2)!​)=k=1∑∞​k((z−k)2n−1(2n−2)!​−(z+k)2n−1(2n−2)!​)=k=1∑∞​k((−k)2n−1(2n−2)!​−k2n−1(2n−2)!​)=−2k=1∑∞​k2n(2n−2)!​.​
